title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Balu Forge commissions fully indigenous, automated empty shell production line in Karnataka
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Fully indigenously developed* empty shell production line at Belgaum, Karnataka can manufacture *360,000* *large-calibre shells* annually.
- Powered by near 100% automation using *FANUC Robotics*, the line operates *unmanned* with a cycle time of *55 seconds* and was designed *in-house*, with contributions from *18 machinery manufacturers*.
- The project aligns with *Atmanirbhar Bharat mission*, initially catering to 155 mm shells but designed to support 120 mm, 105 mm and 81 mm formats.

items.title: Taural India supplies aluminium castings for Triveni’s indigenous patrol vessel gearboxes
Unilever wants HUL to follow India growth path, says CEO
Korea signs Peru deal for tanks and armored vehicles
items.summary:
- Peru plans to buy 195 ground units from South Korea, including 54 **K2 tanks** and 141 wheeled armored vehicles.
- The deal is the largest ever for South Korean defence exports to **Latin America** and could mark the **K2**'s first entry into the region.
- Context notes Poland's recent 180 **K2 tanks** deal with Hyundai Rotem, underscoring the tank's expanding footprint in Europe.

items.title: Welspun One to develop logistics park in Pune’s Talegaon with ₹550-cr investment
Amazon to invest $35 billion in India to scale AI and logistics operations
Assocham cautions against blanket duty cuts on auto components in proposed EU trade pact
Skill shortages and policy delays hindering MSME growth in Vijayawada
Maharashtra to add 400 new GCCs in next 5 years
items.summary:
- Maharashtra plans to add 400 *GCCs* in the next five years, led by **MIDC** CEO P Velrasu.
- Pune is emerging as a major *GCC hub*, hosting nearly a quarter of India's GCCs.
- The state is pushing new policies including **EV infrastructure**, **Bamboo** policy, and an Educity near Navi Mumbai to attract more sectors and boost infrastructure.

items.title: Lilly to build $6B Alabama plant to boost US manufacturing
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Lilly to invest over **$6B** in a Huntsville active drug ingredient facility to boost US production and shorten supply chains.
- The third US site will manufacture small-molecule and peptide medicines, including orforglipron, with construction starting in 2026 and about 3,000 construction jobs.
- The project uses **AI** and **automation** and aims for carbon neutrality, underscoring onshoring of API production.

items.title: Urea imports zoom 137% as output dips 4% in Apr-Oct
items.summary:
- India imported *136.6%* more urea in Apr-Oct 2025 as domestic production dipped *4%*, per the Fertilizer Association of India.
- DAP imports rose *69.1%* despite a *7.4%* fall in production; NP/NPK output rose *12.6%*, imports *80.6%*, while MOP imports fell *22.1%*.
- *China disruption* and a good monsoon boosted demand after kharif, with imports from higher-cost markets; subsidies and two new urea plants push India toward *self-sufficiency*.

items.title: Aerospace supply bottlenecks slow airline growth despite rising demand
Tata Steel acquires majority stake in Thriveni Pellets to boost raw material supply chain
Centre disburses ₹1,350 cr under PLI Auto Scheme; 82 approved
items.summary:
- The government has disbursed ₹1,350.83 crore under the *PLI Auto Scheme* to boost domestic *Advanced Automotive Technology* (AAT) and the *EV value chain* as of 30 Nov 2025. 
- **82 applicants** were approved across Champion OEMs and Component Champions; 278 units are spread across states, led by Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Haryana and Karnataka. 
- Eligible sales reached ₹32,879 crore against a ₹231,500 crore target for 2028, with major players like **Tata Motors**, Mahindra & Mahindra, Hyundai, Kia, Suzuki, Ashok Leyland, Hero, Bajaj, Ola Electric, Piaggio, and suppliers such as **Bosch**, **Motherson Sumi**, **Schaeffler India**, **Wabco India**.

items.title: Microsoft to invest $17.5B in India for AI, cloud
items.summary: - *Microsoft* will invest **$17.5 billion** in *India* to boost *AI* and *cloud infrastructure*, signaling a major expansion in one of its fastest-growing markets. - CEO *Satya Nadella* highlighted *India's AI ambitions* and a plan to build infrastructure, skills, and *sovereign capabilities* for an *AI-first future*. - This follow-up comes after an earlier **$3 billion** pledge and cements Microsoft's push into *Asia* for leading *AI*-driven growth.

items.title: Cisco partners CII to set-up CoE in Mumbai; aims to skill over 2.7 mn individuals in AI, cybersecurity
Electronics industry asks government to allow China JVs with 26% stake cap
India, Sweden decarbonising steel and cement sectors
items.summary:
- Seven pre‑pilot feasibility studies, funded by the *DST* and the *Swedish Energy Agency*, target decarbonising India's steel and cement sectors.
- Innovations include *hydrogen in rotary kilns*, recycling steel slag to green cement, and using *AI* to aid cement decarbonisation.
- Key participants include Tata Steel, JK Cement, Ambuja Cement, Jindal Steel, Prism Johnson, Cemvision, Kanthal, Swerim, and IITs (IIT Bombay, IIT-ISM Dhanbad, IIT Bhubaneswar, IIT Hyderabad) plus Datta Meghe College of Engineering.

items.title: Govt cancels 5,371 licences of fertiliser firms for malpractices during Apr-Nov: Nadda
Ola only battery PLI beneficiary with established capacity: Centre
NUPPL Ghatampur Unit-2 begins ops; full 1,980 MW by FY26
items.summary:
- *NUPPL*'s *Unit-2* (660 MW) of the *Ghatampur* Thermal Power Project achieved commercial operation on 9 Dec 2025, lifting the capacity to 1,320 MW.
- By *FY26*, the full *1,980 MW* project will be online, projected to generate about *14,743 MUs* annually for around *12 million households*.
- It uses *supercritical* technology with *FGD* and *SCR*, supports ~25,000 jobs, and ties to the *Pachwara South coal mine* for fuel from FY26.

items.title: Godrej Agrovet to set up ₹150 crore dairy processing facility in Telangana
Covestro-Allmed study on recycling artificial kidney filters
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Covestro and Allmed have joined to study the feasibility of *recycling* artificial kidney filters and to explore recovering *polycarbonate* for use in new recycled-content materials.
- The partners will assess technical and economic viability while addressing *regulatory* requirements for medical waste management, with initial trials planned in the *United Kingdom* through Allmed’s distribution partner *Kimal*.
- The effort aims to create circular pathways for *medical devices* in healthcare, demonstrating that environmental responsibility can align with medical performance.

items.title: Vahan.ai expands hiring into textiles and electronics
items.summary:
- *Vahan.ai* expands its hiring operations into **textile and electronics manufacturing** in India.
- It is mobilising workers from *Jharkhand*, *Uttar Pradesh*, and *Bihar* to hubs in **Karnataka** and **Tamil Nadu**.
- The move aligns with India’s plan for $1 trillion manufacturing output by 2025–26 and showcases AI-led recruitment.

items.title: Cummins India CPCB IV+ genset at EXCON 2025
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Cummins India unveiled its *CPCB IV+* 82.5 kVA genset at *EXCON 2025* in Bengaluru, plus diesel and hydrogen engines and after‑treatment tech for infrastructure, construction and mining.
- Showcased QSB4.5/L10/M15 diesel engines and the *B6.7H hydrogen engine* (up to 290 HP, 1,200 Nm) built on a *fuel-agnostic architecture*.
- A 9‑inch *Single Module aftertreatment* for gensets and equipment removes >99% of PM, is lighter, and highlights Cummins’ focus on power solutions; details at Hall 4, Booth C-53.

items.title: Graphite India, Kivoro sign exclusive partnership for graphene-based heat transfer additives
Brakes India acquires 10% stake in Japan’s TBK to strengthen global CV braking business
ZF showcases local manufacturing push, advanced driveline technologies at EXCON 2025
Thapar Institute, Bajaj Auto to set up ₹15 cr skill centre
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- The MoU between **Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology** and **Bajaj Auto** will establish the **BEST Centre** on TIET's campus, funded with ₹15 crore from Bajaj Auto’s CSR.
- The centre will occupy 20,000 sq ft of lab space and offer joint certification from TIET and Bajaj Auto Ltd.
- It focuses on *Mechatronics*, *Robotics & Automation*, *Industry 4.0*, and *Smart Manufacturing*, advancing engineering education via CSR initiatives.

items.title: MIC Electronics wins first railway order for RMPU controller
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- MIC Electronics wins its first Indian Railways order for a Microprocessor Controller for Roof Mounted AC Package Units (RMPU), approved by *RDSO*. 
- The order from *Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR)* targets *LHB passenger coaches*, marking MIC's expansion into railway automation. 
- Deliveries will be completed within 45 days with after-sales support, aiding wider adoption as Indian Railways transitions to *LHB* and double-decker AC coaches.

items.title: How Odisha govt is steering a ₹5 lakh crore industrial investment push by 2029
Microsoft in talks with Broadcom for custom AI chips
items.summary: - Microsoft is in talks with *Broadcom* to design *custom AI chips* for future infrastructure, potentially moving from *Marvell* and aligning with *OpenAI*. - The discussions follow *OpenAI*'s deal with *Broadcom*, signaling a push to secure purpose-built silicon and reduce reliance on *Nvidia*. - The move signals intensifying competition to secure *AI compute infrastructure* as demand grows.

items.title: Record-low battery storage bids in India can undermine project viability: Experts
Adani invests ₹10k crore in Telangana, 7k+ jobs created
items.summary:
- The Adani Group has invested nearly *₹10,000 crore* in Telangana over three years, **creating 7,000+ jobs**.
- Investments span *Defense manufacturing*, *Green Data Centers*, Renewable energy, and Cement facilities, including a **48 MW data center**.
- A *defense and aerospace park* with a **UAV facility in Hyderabad**, plus ₹4,000 crore in roads delivering 100+ km of highways, underpins long‑term growth.

items.title: Apollo Micro Systems lines up ₹1,500 crore greenfield expansion for defence manufacturing in Telangana
Minda gets Yamuna Expressway land for ₹500 crore manufacturing unit
Telangana’s loss is Andhra’s gain as pharma companies expand in Kurnool
Vingroup to invest $3 billion in Telangana across urban development, EVs and energy
Innomotics India to acquire Siemens LV and geared motors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Innomotics India will acquire Siemens Limited's *Low Voltage (LV) Motors* and *Geared Motors* business in *India*. 
- The deal adds an *end-to-end portfolio* including LV, Geared, high‑voltage motors and large drives, aligning with *Innomotics*' global operations. 
- The move enables more customised solutions and strengthens the *brand presence* of *Innomotics India* across the Indian market.

items.title: More companies plan hiring in March quarter but overall hiring volumes to come down
Tata eyes IAF's Medium Transport Aircraft contract, to set up MRO
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **Tata** aims to clinch the *Medium Transport Aircraft* contract and set up Bengaluru *MRO* for C-130J.
- TASL already partners with **Lockheed Martin** for C-130 empennages and aims for the first C-130J by early 2027.
- The race includes Airbus, Lockheed Martin and Embraer, with ~80 aircraft to replace the ageing AN-32 fleet.

items.title: Trump approves Nvidia AI chips sales to China
items.summary:
- **Nvidia**'s H200 AI chips could be sold to *approved customers* in China, aiming to support *American jobs* and U.S. manufacturing.
- Critics in the Senate warned such exports could bolster China's military tech and cyber capabilities.
- Nvidia welcomed the move, saying the Commerce Department would vet buyers to balance *economic interests* with *national security* concerns.

items.title: Mark Titus Appointed President, Nippon Paint India
items.summary:
- **Mark Titus** has been appointed President – Decorative Business at Nippon Paint India, effective *1 December 2025*, reporting to **Sharad Malhotra**.
- He will lead the *decorative coatings* business across India, driving strategy across product, channel, digital and brand platforms with a focus on innovation and growth.
- With over two decades in FMCG and paints, Titus will strengthen Nippon Paint India's presence through partnerships, digital engagement and sustainable expansion.

items.title: Intel-Tata pact to make semiconductors in India
items.summary:
- Intel and **Tata** ink a pact to manufacture and assemble *semiconductors* in **India** for the local market and to scale AI PC solutions.
- The plan centers on facilities in Dholera, Gujarat and Assam, with a total investment of ₹1.18 lakh crore, and advanced packaging/EMS collaboration.
- The deal strengthens India’s supply chain, OSAT/EMS capabilities, and global AI compute leadership by 2030.

items.title: Parity in corrosion protection: domestic vs export cars
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Export-bound* vehicles use galvanised steel and longer *corrosion warranties*; Indian *domestic cars* often have minimal galvanisation.
- Rust-related damage raises safety risks and long-term costs, lowering resale value.
- Updating *CMVR* and *BIS* standards could ensure parity, boosting longevity and consumer value.

items.title: Telangana Rising Global Summit secures ₹1.88 lakh cr investments on Day 1
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - Telangana Rising Global Summit Day 1 saw investment proposals totalling *₹1.88 lakh crore* across *Deep Tech*, *Core Infrastructure*, and *Future City*.\n- Major deals include *Brookfield / Axis Ventures* ₹75,000 crore, *Evren / Axis Energy* ₹31,500 crore for renewables, *Vin Group* ₹27,000 crore, *GMR Group* ₹15,000 crore, *MEIL* ₹8,000 crore, and Defence MOUs ₹5,000 crore.\n- Chief Minister *A Revanth Reddy* called Day 1 a mandate for *Vision 2047* and pledged to translate investments into jobs, infrastructure and Telangana's rise in India's economy.

items.title: Parliament clears cess on pan masala units
items.summary:
- Parliament approved the **National Security Cess Bill 2025** to levy a **cess** on pan masala manufacturing units to fund **national security** and **public health**.
- The **cess** will be over and above **GST** and based on production capacity of machines in pan masala factories.
- Finance Minister *Nirmala Sitharaman* said the levy will serve the cost of national and health security.

items.title: LG Energy Solution seals $1.4B EV battery deal with MB
items.summary:
- LG Energy Solution signed a deal worth about *2 trillion won* ($1.4B) with **Mercedes-Benz** to supply EV batteries.
- The agreement runs from March 1, 2028, to June 30, 2035, covering deliveries to **North America** and **Europe**.
- Analysts view it as a step toward more affordable models and broader global expansion, with the deal accounting for roughly *8%* of LG Energy Solution's revenue last year.

items.title: JSW Infra to buy 3 rail logistics firms for ₹1,212 cr
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary: - The deal values the acquisition at *₹1,212 crore* and covers three JSW rail logistics units: *Rail Infra Logistics*, *Minerals Rail Logistics*, and *South Rail Logistics*.\n- Post‑closing, the firms become step‑down subsidiaries of *JSW Infrastructure* and give access to *GPWIS* and *LSFTO* schemes for rail freight.\n- JSW Infrastructure aims to expand its *multimodal logistics platform*, scaling its *rake fleet* from 25 to 45 by *FY27* and 110 by *FY30*.

items.title: SFO Tech mulling ₹2,270 crore electronic components plant in Tamil Nadu
